cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 615 miles ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move westward, then turn northwest across the north-western Caribbean, pass near or over western Cuba early next week, and then accelerate north-northeast toward the Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida peninsula (likely west-central coast near Tampa Bay area) after crossing western Cuba

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect as of Advisory #1
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect as of Advisory #1
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, including the east-central coast from Cape Canaveral northward
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (4–8 inches possible across central Florida)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible (dependent on exact track and intensity when crossing peninsula)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible Wednesday (28 Sep) with a 28 % cumulative chance of ≥34 kt; 7 % chance of ≥50 kt
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Ian emerges over the Atlantic just north of the port, onshore flow could produce 2–4 ft of surge along the Space Coast; confidence still low at this early lead time
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy tropical rain bands could bring 4–8 inches with localized higher totals, producing ponding and possible flash-flooding in the port area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and possible tornadoes in outer rainbands as Ian approaches
